abstract: Memo From Iraq; Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani's efforts for more than two months to instruct Iraqi Prime Min Haider al-Abadi in how to strengthen government and create more transparency have raised question of whether he is paving way for clerical rule in country; Sistani has long been antagonistic to idea of clerical rule, yet concerns about sectarian war and growing power of Iran in country has led him to become more active in politics.
lead_paragraph: In the face of concerns over the growing power of Iran and its militia proxies, Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani has intervened in Iraqi politics, at least for now.

headline.main: In Bid to Counter Iran, Ayatollah in Iraq May End Up Emulating It
headline.print_headline: In Bid to Counter Iran, Ayatollah in Iraq May End Up Emulating It

snippet: In the face of concerns over the growing power of Iran and its militia proxies, Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani has intervened in Iraqi politics, at least for now.
